definition: to believe/to be convinced
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: The ambassador-designate will assume duty next month.
sentences.chinese: 这位派定的大使将在下个月就职。

sentences.english: As for my men, I have told them to meet me at a certain place.
sentences.chinese: 故此我已派定少年人在某处等候我。

sentences.english: O LORD, thou hast ordained them for judgment;
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，你派定他为要刑罚人。

sentences.english: The company assigned everybody a sales task.
sentences.chinese: 公司给我们每个人都派定了销售任务量。

sentences.english: LORD, thou hast ordained them for judgment;
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，你派定他为要刑罚人。

sentences.english: I have made an appointment with the young men for such and such a place.
sentences.chinese: 故此我已派定少年人在某处等候我。

sentences.english: Whom Moses and Aaron took with all the multitude of the common people.
sentences.chinese: 梅瑟和亚郎就带着这些提名派定的人。

sentences.english: LORD , you have appointed them to execute judgment;
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，你派定他为要刑罚人。

sentences.english: So I am made to inherit months of vanity, And nights of trouble are appointed to me.
sentences.chinese: 我也照样承受虚空的岁月，有苦难的黑夜为我派定。
